title: Bug 6322: All types dialog displays obfuscated classes prominently
description: The All types dialog in JDK 1.4 is displaying obfuscated classes (e.g., 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') prominently.
OB: Obfuscated classes ('a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') are displayed with the same prominence as regular class names in the All types dialog.
EB: Obfuscated classes should have reduced visibility or prominence compared to regular class names in the All types dialog.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the All types dialog in JDK 1.4.
2. Observe the display of classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd'.
3. Proposed solutions:
   a) Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
   b) Completely filter out obfuscated classes.
Suggested solution: Implement option 'a' for improved visibility of classes.
